values:
Updated Raven and Mana's Bios with pictures and information. 

Raven ~ http://www.livejournal.com/users/robotechdreams/1959.html

Mana ~ http://www.livejournal.com/users/robotechdreams/2097.html

Take a look see?

The memory of my mother's final words to me have lingered in my mind ever since the fateful Launch Day 'celebrations' that brought this hell into all our lives. Before that afternoon, I had not seen my mother in several months. The preparations for the imending Launch Day had kept the Defense Forces scrambling to complete last minute safety checks and duty assignments for the SDF-1 on her maiden voyage into space, and my mother, already absorbed into the project to the point where she spent only a handful of hours at home during her down time to catch some sleep, was even more frenzied to assist in the final preparations. I knew she had not recieved redeployment orders aboard the Battle fortress yet, but neither of us had any doubts that the SDF-1 would be her next post. And that would mean years apart. Despite the enstranged tension between us over my father's death and her absorption into the Robotech Project, I was determined not to let her go into space without seeing my mother one last time. Little did I realise that 'one last time,' was exactly what was in store for us. I asked her, on that fateful afternoon, what made her join the Robotech Defense Forces, after Dad was killed in a freak accident while serving the Defense Forces in his capacity as a test pilot. With bitterness and accusation I demanded to know what made my mother throw her life and career away - even her only daughter - to serve the same military project that had cost us Dad. Why was she so absorbed in this project that she was willing to leave the Earth - and me - behind for years? I don't think I'll ever forget what she said to me then, sipping hot tea from a cermic cup between her two hands. There was regret in her eyes, and sadness in her voice, but there was no compromise in her words to me that day. "Raven, you'll never really understand what it's like to give your life in service to a cause that matters more than life itself until you have to make that choice for yourself. You make that choice not for the sake of the cause, but for the sake of your loved ones and all those who would be benefiting from your sacrifices - whether they understand the purpose behind those sacrifices or not." It sometimes seems strange to me that my mother's final words to me would have become the foundation for the rest my life - a life I had never wanted for myself, a path I would have never considered before those last words with my mother over a cup of Hot Tea. ~from the pages of "The Ballad of Fallen Angels: No Tears For the Damned" An excerpt from the Collected Journals of Raven Nicole Black.
New 7/24/04 Name: Silas Grey (This Biography is Constantly Being Updated)

UPDATE 7/23/04 Name: Samantha "Mana" Kwan Birthdate: 12/31/90 Age At Beginning of Macross Saga: 18 Height: 5'5" Weight: 132 lbs. Hair: Slate Blue Eyes: Brown Hometown: Tokyo, Japan Parents: Both Alive Siblings: Brother, Heero, Dead (Macross Island, 2009) Deployment: Robotech Defense Forces Aboard SDF-1 Assignment: Veritech "Valkerie" Squadrons Aboard SDF-1, Member of the Skull Squadron. Rank: Corporal. Fighter Trim: None. Fighter Model: Generic VT-1A Background and Significant Events: Adopted at birth by a Englishman and his Chinese Wife, Samantha was raised as the darling apple of her father's eye. At every possibility he doted on the little girl, and she loves him fiercely in return. From her father, Samantha found a passion for video games and fantasy past times that - growing up - she had few friends to share with, so she spent most of her free time with her father and her older brother, the noble Heero Kwan, who was a Marine Commander during the Global Civial War and was Assigned Duty as a Destroid Pilot on Macross Island when the Robotech Project got underway. When her mother abandoned her and her father Samantha was only eleven, and the shouted recriminations of her mother - that Samantha had come between them too many times - burned into her heart. She never forgave herself for driving her mother away from them - as she saw it - and a rift formed between father and daughter. When Launch Day approached on Macross Island, Samantha recieved a personal invitation from her brother Heero to attent the festivities of the Launch Day Ceremonies. Much to her father's dismay, she went to Macross Island, and was swept up in the Zentradi Invasion. Her brother died during the defense of Macross City, and Samantha was taken aboard the SDF-1 as one of her permanent residents when the ship made a hyperspace fold miscalculation, winding up on the far side of the Planet Pluto. When the Zentradi began to resume their attacks on the lost and beleagured SDF-1, Samantha was among the first class of recruits to go through the shipboard Robotech Academy, and graduated near the top of her class. She was assigned to the Skull Squadron, under the command of Lt. Commander Roy Fokker, and paired with another member of her graduating class, Raven Black, her new roommate AND wingmate. This is kinda the hair coloring I picture for Mana, but longer and straight. (This page is constantly being updated)

UPDATED: 7/23/04 Name: Raven Nicole Black Birthday: 10/14/89 Age at Beginning of Macross Saga: 19 Height: 5'9" Weight: 159 lbs. Hair: Glossy Black Eyes: Blue Hometown: Macross City. Parents: Both Dead: ~Father: During RDF Test Piloting of the Veritech Fighters. ~Mother: During the Fold Operation over Macross Island. Siblings: None Deployment: Robotech Defense Forces Aboard SDF-1 Assignment: Veritech "Valkerie" Squadrons Aboard SDF-1, Member of the Skull Squadron. Rank: Corporal, Skull 24. Fighter Trim: None. Fighter Model: Generic VT-1A Background and Significant Events: After her father was killed during tests of the Veritech Fighter, young Raven had to watch her mother throw herself into the same test program that had claimed the life of her father. Mother and Daughter grew apart as Raven - unable to comprehend her mother's obssession with Robotech - and her Mother - unwilling or unable to explain to her daughter the importance and nesseccity of the Robotech Program - moved away from each other. When her mother suggested that Raven test for aptitude with the Robotech Defense Forces, Raven flatly refused, moving off-base on her 18th birthday. The two rarely spoke during the next year, until - on Launch Day, when faced with the prospect of not seeing her mother again for many years - Raven relented and invited her mother out for Chinese at the Lynn Family Restaurant. Over Hot Tea and Chinese Food, Raven's Mother began to explain the desperate need she felt to be a part of the Robotech Project - to be one of the defenders of Earth's future - when the Zentradi sneak attack took everyone by surprise. Raven's mother perished during the Fold Operation that transplanted the SDF-1 and the Island of Macross beyond the orbit of the planet Pluto, but Raven was transferred safely aboard the SDF-1. At first, when the recruitment drive went out among the citizens of Macross, Raven refused to join the fighting, holding them to blame for the deaths of both her Father AND her Mother. But as the Zentradi attacks increased in ferocity, Raven began to ponder her Mother's Final Words to her: "Raven, you'll never really understand what it's like to give your life in service to a cause that matters more than life itself until you have to make that choice for yourself. You make that choice not for the sake of the cause, but for the sake of your loved ones and all those who would be benefiting from your sacrifices..." The next day, Raven joined the Defense Forces. She graduated among the top in her class, and was assigned to the elite Veritech Fighter Squadrons, serving under Lt. Commander Roy Fokker in the Skull Squadron along side Samanatha Kwan, her new roommate and wingmate.
Here is an idea of what I picture Raven looking like. She actually LOOKS a little bit like me too. What do you think?
